etymology.description: phonetic 府 (OC *poʔ) + semantic 肉 (“flesh; body”).
etymology.interpretation: Meaning arises from the flesh component, pointing to things of the body or meat, especially when spoiling or curdling. Sound is borrowed from 府 (fǔ), and the sense broadened to decay and soy products like tofu that involve coagulation/fermentation.

examples.chinese: 这块木头开始腐烂(這塊木頭開始腐爛)。
examples.english: This piece of wood is starting to rot.

examples.chinese: 我们晚餐做了麻婆豆腐(我們晚餐做了麻婆豆腐)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen wǎncān zuò le Mápó dòufu.
examples.english: We made mapo tofu for dinner.

examples.chinese: 政府加强反腐(政府加強反腐)，减少官员腐败(減少官員腐敗)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèngfǔ jiāqiáng fǎnfǔ, jiǎnshǎo guānyuán fǔbài.
examples.english: The government is strengthening anti-corruption efforts and reducing official corruption.
